p: A comparative study of the MERS-CoV full genome sequence showed a higher homology and closeness phylogenetic with bats coronavirus than with coronavirus from other animals [ 17], leading to believed that MERS-CoV would originate from bats. Curiously, some studies showed that MERS-CoV patients from Saudi Arabia who have jobs involving camels have a higher prevalence of MERS-CoV antibodies than other individuals. These findings, associated with high antibodies levels of MERS-CoV, which also have been detected in camels, showed that these animals can be a source of spread of the infection through human-animal contact [ 18].
